music.description: Co-produced with Lymbic, the album offers a captivating journey through electronic vibes, solid grooves, esoteric arpeggios and wild synths, promising a cosmic adventure for the listener. The track “Drive your Cart” was featured in a BMW commercial.

music.title: Apollo 11 Reloaded
music.author: Martux_M ft. Giulio Maresca
music.label: Parco Della Musica Records
music.description:
A collaborative project with Giulio Maresca, dedicated to the 50th anniversary of the moon landing, unfolds as a complete audiovisual experience. Featuring archival images from the Istituto Luce and the Italian Space Agency curated by Bruno Palma, the project premiered live on New Year’s Eve at the Festa di Roma.
The album itself embodies an electronic psychedelia, offering a musical odyssey that narrates the various stages of the Apollo 11 mission. From the departure in the opening track “Lift Off” to the return to Earth depicted in “Return,” the journey traverses the diverse realms of electronic music. Techno, dub, and ambient elements intermingle with melodic psychedelia, encapsulating the essence of the historic voyage.

music.title: My Love Supreme
music.author: Martux_M Crew ft. Francesco Bearzatti
music.label: Musica Jazz
music.description: A new jazz album presenting a tribute to John Coltrane's "A Love Supreme". Martux_M wanted to investigate the essence of Coltrane's masterpiece and felt the need to revisit the message of gratitude that inspired him. "My Love Supreme" is a celebration of a sacred universal love of this great artist.

music.title: Imagine
music.author: Martux_M Crew
music.label: Parco Della Musica Records
music.description:
"Martux_M revisited jazz with an electronic reinterpretation of Miles Davis' iconic work.
While reading his biography, I was struck by the phrase ‘I have to constantly change, it's a curse.’ So I decided to reinterpret those compositions as if Miles were playing them today alongside artists like Jeff Mills or Carl Craig.”
- Martux_M in Indie for Bunnies interview

music.title: About A Silent Way
music.author: Martux_M
music.label: Itinera
music.description: With "About A Silent Way", Martux_M returned to jazz after many years, but from a different perspective. The album is an electronic reinterpretation of Miles Davis' iconic work. While reading his biography, Martux_M was struck by the phrase: "I have to constantly change, it's a curse", which led him to reinterpret those compositions as if Miles were playing them today alongside artists like Jeff Mills or Carl Craig.

music.title: Reminiscence

music.label: Parco Della Musica Records
music.description: Jazz and electronics come together in the album co-created with Danilo Rea. Original compositions and free improvisations, featuring the voices of Silvia Colombini and Gian Paolo Fiocchi, result in 12 tracks that transcend ambient music and contemporary classical.

music.title: X-Scape Project
music.author: Martux_M Crew
music.label: Persistence Bit
music.description:
“X-Scape Project” is a multimedia experience that engages different senses through video and sound. In this audiovisual performance the opposition between material and immaterial is overcome by a labyrinth of light, space, emptiness, and complex vibrations.
The video design was made by Mattia Casalegno.
“X-Scape Project” was presented at the International Festival of Contemporary Music (Venice) and Digital Life Festival (Rome).

visual.title: La Maschera del Tempo
visual.author: Martux_M in collaboration with Mattia Casalegno
visual.description:
Audiovisual installation set in the picturesque open-air theatre of San Giorgio Island in Venice. It offers a unique perspective of the theatre and a visionary glimpse into an utopian future where nature has reclaimed its space.
Commissioned by Giorgio Cini Foundation, the work combines footage from the foundation's archive with images generated with experimental technologies and programs, such as Midjourney, Open AI and Unreal Engine 5.
It was showcased at the Venice Biennale (2022) and included in the exhibition "Extension of Selves" in China's Wuhan Art Museum (2024).

visual.title: Intervallo
visual.author: Martux_M in collaboration with Mattia Casalegno and Stefano Baldi
visual.description:
In this audiovisual performance., Martux_M and Mattia Casalegno bring homage to the history and culture of Italy through live electronic music and live-generated visuals.
The project takes its title from a show series aired by the State Italian TV (RAI) that became a symbol of Italian heritage and cultural identity during the 70s and 80s. The show, aired daily, consisted of slides of famous Italian landmarks and less-known regional sites, accompanied by text commentary and classical music. Casalegno’s studio meticulously collected and cataloged thousands of Italian postcards. The dataset was employed to train a Generative Adversarial Network (GAN) model, which in turn generated the visual content for the performance.
The performance was presented in the Festa della Republica Italiana in 2021, organized by the Italian Institute of Culture in Vienna.

visual.title: Controllo e divenire
visual.author: Martux_M and Bruno Palma
visual.description:
“Controllo e divenire” is and installation by Martux_M and Bruno Palma. The work was presented in Rome between 2018 and 2019.
In Sanscrit the word "mandala" means circle and in the Tibetan culture it is used to represent the Universe, both exterior and interior. The making of the mandala requires starting the pattern from the very center to favor a gradual opening in an outward direction. In the Buddhist tradition mandalas are created with coloured sands to be then destroyed, a metaphor of the transience of things.
For its strong symbolic and evocative value the mandala is the image chosen by the artists to represent the evolution of the earth's climate change in the last 160 years. The image in motion which creates the mandala and, at the same time, shows the data of  the Earth's climate change from 1850 up to now through chromatic variations, is projected in a loop on a salt surface.
From blue which expresses the status of natural balance, moving through the whole spectrum of colors, we get to red that symbolizes that boundary condition where the ecosystem is on its break point. In this way the chromatic evolution reproduces visually the changes the different areas of the globe have undergone through time, allowing an immediate and intuitive perception of global warming.
In order to highlight the fragility of matter and  simultaneously the urge to preserve it, like in a kaleidoscope the images of the mandala turn into the four natural elements -fire, air, water and earth- , in which every substance that constitutes matter  originates. Love and discord rule them in a continuous cycle like a breath. The former keeps them together in harmony within a sphere, the latter destroys them and takes them into chaos.
So in this work, the four elements that come alive on the salt surface, the element both of preservation and cooling par excellence, realize a symmetrical dance opposing the darkness of death. The sound of the installation is composed only of the sounds of the four elements, sampled and organized in space as in a choral singing, which finds, in a fragile balance, the auditory essence of the world. 
To trust the world also means  to give life to the creation of new space-time dimensions, to create a rebel art that urges and imposes an undelayable action on our conscience.
Text by Anna Cestelli Guidi

visual.title: The Suspended Gesture
visual.author: Martux_M in collaboration with Mattia Casalegno
visual.description:
Audiovisual installation exploring the theme of metamorphosis: digitally generating zoomorphic figures derived from details of fashion designer Roberto Capucci's dress sculptures. The installation comprises six light and sound sculptures dynamically interacting with the surrounding environment: the sculptures respond to visitors' movements as they approach.
Commissioned by the Roberto Capucci Foundation for the opening of the AltaRomAltaModa event, it was showcased at the Temple of Adriano in Rome.
